verses.verse: (David driven forth of his kingdom, was greatly tormented in mind for his sins against God: 4 And therefore calleth upon God, and waxeth bold through his promises, against the great railings and terrors of his enemies, yea against death itself, which he saw present before his eyes.7 Finally, he rejoiceth for the good success that God gave him and all the Church. ) Lord, how are mine adversaries increased? how many rise against me?
Many say to my soul, There is no help for him in God. (Selah here signifieth a lifting up of the voice, to cause us to consider the sentence, as a thing of great importance.) Selah.
But thou Lord art a buckler for me, my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.
I did call unto the Lord with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy mountain. Selah.
I laid me down and slept, and rose up again: for the Lord sustained me.
I will not be afraid for (When he considered the truth of Godâ€™s promise, and tried the same, his faith increased marvelously.) ten thousand of the people, that should beset me round about.
O Lord, arise: help me, my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheekbone: thou hast broken the teeth of the wicked.
(Be the dangers never so great or many, yet God hath ever means to deliver his.) Salvation belongeth unto the Lord, and thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.
